name: nnForge
tagline: Convolutional and fully-connected neural networks C++ library
body:
What is nnForge?
----------------

nnForge is a library for training convolutional and fully-connected neural networks. It includes CPU and GPU (CUDA) backends.

The library implements Stochastic Diagonal Levenberg-Marquardt training algorithm, well described in:
* Y. LeCun, L. Bottou, Y. Bengio and P. Haffner: Gradient-Based Learning Applied to Document Recognition, _Proceedings of the IEEE, 86(11):2278-2324, November 1998_
* Y. LeCun, L. Bottou, G. Orr and K. Muller: Efficient BackProp, in Orr, G. and Muller K. (Eds), _Neural Networks: Tricks of the trade, Springer, 1998_

You will find these papers at [Yann LeCun site](http://yann.lecun.com/exdb/publis/index.html).

It also has "dropout" regularization implemented:
* Improving neural networks by preventing co-adaptation of feature detectors, Geoffery Hinton, Nitish Srivastava, Alex Krizhevsky, Ilya Sutskever, and Ruslan Salakhutdinov, [arXiv, 2012](http://arxiv.org/pdf/1207.0580.pdf)

The package contains not only nnForge library but also examples - applications using the library.

License
-------

nnForge is an open-source software distributed under the [Apache License v2.0](http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0).

Download
--------

Get [archive](https://github.com/milakov/nnForge/tarball/master) with the latest version v1.0.2. Release notes for all the version are published at [Maxim Milakov's website](http://www.milakov.org/blogs/category/nnForge%20releases/).

Prerequisites
-------------

The library depends on [Boost](http://www.boost.org/) and [OpenCV](http://opencv.org/).

If you want to use CUDA backend you will also need [CUDA Toolkit](https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit) installed.

Authors
-------

nnForge is designed and implemented by [Maxim Milakov](http://milakov.org).
